result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Neil Huber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to contact the Clerk of Court within 20 days of release from serving jail sentence to set up a payment plan.  Failure to set up a payment plan or pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears in person from JASO with SPD William Poss. Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Restitution has been paid in full per SPD Poss.  Confirmed by clerk - paid by credit card to GPS.  Recommendation of $100 plus costs.  Court accepts recommendation of $100 plus costs.  Court orders a fine of $100 plus costs to be paid by defendant requesting a payment plan within 20 days after release from jail from serving a possible 6 month jail sentence on another case still to be determined.
$80.00 coming from GPS.  LAM
Sentencing hearing at 11-16-2015 10:30 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Restitution $80.00 stipulated.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge.  Victim notification complied with.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as charged.  Joint recommendation for $100, plus costs and restitution.  State wanted restitution paid up front.  Not paid yet.  State wants to postpone sentencing so that restitution is paid prior to sentencing.  SEH set for 11/16/15 at 10:30 am.
Restitution worksheet.

Pre-trial conference at 10-14-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 11-02-2015 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Poss appeared in court.   Waive reading of complaint.  Defendant remained mute.  NGP entered by court.  PTC 10/14  & STC 11/2/15 at 3 pm.   Bond continued.
Not to write any checks.
WSPD eligibility form.  Defendant is not eligible for SPD representation.
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-21-2015 09:30 am
